notesStmt.note: Defective at the beginning (the first leaf of the first quire is missing). Stained. Ink is fading on the last few pages.
Avraham: inscribed (folio 88v). Aharon: apparently a brother of the scribe, inscribed in the body of the text as the first recipient of the manuscript (folio 50v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A liturgical collection and Moses Kimḥi's Mahalakh shevile ha-daʿat.

collation.p: Quires of 10 leaves each, marked with catchwords and signatures at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian square and semi-cursive script of the 15th century. Punctuated.

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown leather. Boxed. Spine: 'Psalmi et Preces. R. Dav. Kimhi. Grammar. Hebr. Mus. Brit. Jure Empt. 18,693.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Adolphus Asher (b. 1800, d. 1853), Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum 1841-1853: purchased from him on 24 May 1851: inscribed, [89v].
